CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Kristina Pardalos;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and had been living in GPE . On DATE he died .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant bought a plot of land ( no . CARDINAL ) in GPE . The land was later divided in CARDINAL parts ( plot nos . DATE CARDINAL , CARDINAL , DATE and DATE ) .
CARDINAL . Upon GPE decision to put a notice in ORG in DATE , the applicant learned that there was a water pipeline passing underneath plot no . DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( the “ ISKI ” ) filed an action with ORG and requested the annulment of the title deed of the applicant to the land in question and its registration in their name . In this respect , they submitted that they had occupied the disputed plot of land since DATE by way of laying down a water pipeline underneath it and that , therefore , it should be registered under its name pursuant to LAW no . ORG .

CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings a commission of experts examined the documentary evidence and conducted an onsite inspection together with the court . On DATE the experts submitted their report where they considered , inter alia , that the land in question would be worth around CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL NORP liras . In the annexed document it was noted that plot no . DATE was de facto a road .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , noting that as of DATE the ORG of First Instance had become operational , transferred the case to it .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of First Instance , on the basis of the evidence , particularly official documents concerning the construction of the water pipeline , accepted the request of the ORG and ordered that the land be registered in their name . It considered , in particular , that the applicant 's property rights over the land in question had ceased , following the expiry of the statutory timelimit provided under LAW of the Law no . ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant appealed . Referring to a court case concerning the previous owner of the plot of land , the applicant submitted , inter alia , that the water pipeline in question passed through another plot and not plot no . DATE , and that the statutory time - limit provided under LAW no . ORG had not expired since a notice was put in ORG only in DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the firstinstance court 's judgment . The applicant 's request for rectification was rejected on DATE . This decision was served on him on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG annulled LAW no . ORG .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant asked ORG to reopen the proceedings on the ground , inter alia , that , according to their own investigation there were no water pipelines passing underneath plot no . DATE and , consequently , the court 's earlier decision had been based on erroneous official documents and the false testimony of ORG officials .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of First Instance dismissed the applicant 's request on the ground that the applicant had already made similar claims in the earlier proceedings , that in the presence of official documents there was no need , in such cases , to investigate by digging up the disputed land , and that , although LAW no . ORG had been subsequently annulled by ORG , this was not a reason for reopening the proceedings .
CARDINAL . The applicant 's appeal and subsequent request for a rectification was dismissed by ORG on DATE and CARDINAL DATE respectively .

CARDINAL . In DATE the Ümraniye Magistrates ' Court , upon the applicant 's request , conducted an onsite inspection of the land . The appointed experts considered that the water pipelines in question were not laid underneath the applicant 's plot but next to it .

CARDINAL . In DATE the Ümraniye Magistrates ' Court , upon the ORG 's request , conducted another inspection of the land . The appointed experts considered that the water pipelines in question passed next to plot no . DATE , not underneath it .
CARDINAL . A full description of the domestic law may be found in GPE ( Çökmez ) and Others v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
